job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Beaumont, TX
pros: Great co-workers, the management of the unit is kind and easy to work with
cons: Charting system is outdated (Medhost), there is a lot of physical paperwork involved, which doesn't make sense because there is also computer charting, there is a high turnover rate and always lots of travel nurses so you're constantly orienting someone, they will triple the staff nurses before they triple the travel nurses in ICU, the scanners for medications don't work half of the time, they will use the RN as a tech but then also assign you 1 patient, so you're running around the whole time helping everyone while also trying to keep up with your patient

pros: Few nice coworkers the others tell the management what to do and they do it!
cons: Overworked, no lunch, (eat a cracker while admitting a patient). Overwhelmed with nurse patient ratio. No help! Noone cares! Pay nurses from all over the US $60, $70, $90 dollars a hour and offer nothing to your local staff.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) in Beaumont, TX
pros: People you work with are nice
cons: Pay is too little ok

pros: The teamwork in the ICU is fantastic, especially on nights. The manager is very helpful and willing to work with you and will make sure you are well-educated on everything.
cons: The doctors are usually very hard to work with and cranky; they don't mind yelling at you just because they've had a bad day. Also the CNO is very unaware of what real bedside nursing is like, and likes to make and enforce rules that don't really make sense for a real practicing nurse (I.e. no water bottles? Let's make our nurses dehydrated). Sometimes the staffing ratio is unsafe (more so on the medical floors). Also, our benefits are crappy. We don't get any holiday pay even though we're forced to work them, and good luck trying to call in sick, it's like the Spanish Inquisition.

review_title: I love my job. I love my top bosses. I despise my direct boss that does not look out for any employees.
pros: Our crew works together on days to get our job done. We work together and finish out jobs before we get off work. We love each other and are a true family.
cons: We all despise our direct boss. We have never seen her degrees do not know if it exist. We do know not only is she fake on the outside she is fake on the inside. If you see her you will know what I am saying.

pros: Freedom to take time off when needed
cons: Your PTO is for personal time AND holiday time/office closures. Holiday is not a separate pay scheme.

review_title: Pharmacy Dept poorly run - years behind other hospitals
pros: None - The pharmacy department is about 20 years behind in terms of management philosophy, technology, and clinical services offered (or lack thereof).
cons: No one will make a decision - too ready to defer to the doctors. The leadership is non-existent. Technicians run rampant with no sense of responsibility. The "buyer" does not know what he is doing. Patient safety is not a priority here.

pros: I worked with some of the best doctors in the area. Great nurses and patients. Work load was plentiful. We sometimes got to leave early on Fridays
cons: Too many chiefs, not enough Indians. Favoritism in certain departments. Had to use saved up PTO for holidays

review_title: Great learning experience, poor upper management
